alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 5:41PM MDT until June 27 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Logan, Morgan and Weld. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 541 PM MDT, emergency management reported small stream flooding continues in some areas. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Platte River, Beall Creek, Cottonwood Creek, South Pawnee Creek, East Lewis Creek, West Fork Cottonwood Creek, Darby Creek, Baymer Creek, George Creek, Brush Creek, Pawnee Inlet Number 1, Pawnee Creek, Springdale Creek, Sand Creek and Spring Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sterling, Crook, North Sterling Reservoir, Padroni, Logan Corners, Atwood, Pawnee Pass, Willard, Stoneham and Twin Buttes.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
